channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: One of the embryo model studies I wrote about the other day is officially published in Nature: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-023-06368-y And one that I didn't write about is also published there: https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-023-06354-4 So that's 5 embryo models, w/more to come...

item.title: Dorothy Bishop
item.description: Looking forward to speaking at the Festival of Open Research at University of Southampton today ,where I will emphasize the importance of open research for identifying fraud. https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/festival-of-open-research-2023-university-of-southampton-tickets-597807216477

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Cytoelectric Coupling: How Brain Waves Sculpt The Structure Of The MindA bold new theory proposes that electric fields could be the architects of the innermost workings of the brain.
https://www.iflscience.com/cytoelectric-coupling-how-brain-waves-sculpt-the-structure-of-the-mind-69561

item.title: Jeff Johnson
item.description: GMail is Breaking Email[By the way, I'm not the author of the linked blog post, and I've muted this conversation because there were too many replies.]http://www.igregious.com/2023/03/gmail-is-breaking-email.html

item.title: PLOS Biology
item.description:
Looking to use quantitative bioimaging in your experiments? Our new Essay from @bethcimini &co provides a navigational guide for biologists new to quantitative bioimaging, with recommendations and pointers to open source resources. #microscopy #PLOSBiology
https://plos.io/3JCd3Et

item.title: Philip Hubbard
item.description: Takashi Kawase has released a #linux version of VVDViewer (https://github.com/JaneliaSciComp/VVDViewer), a powerful volume renderer (#scivis, #sciviz) for #fluorescence #microscopy data. To celebrate, here is a video rendered by VVDViewer as driven by the Linux version of neuVid. The input to neuVid is a high-level description of the video, in this case showing four #drosophila lines from the #HHMIJanelia FlyLight Gen1 MCFO collection. The input text is pretty simple... (1/3)

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Very cool. Representational drift plays a role in plasticity.
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0959438823000715Everything in the brain is likely to have a function. And at the electric field level, there's little representational drift.
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuroimage.2022.119058So, representational drift can do its thing at one level but still result in a stable signal at a higher level.

item.title: Tony Vladusich
item.description: @ekmiller Co-author Earl K. Miller, of the Picower Institute at MIT, recently published a paper suggesting that the brain engages in what was termed “spatial computing”. well, it is all the rage back home

item.title: David Schoppik
item.description: @sls good call -- as an editor it's *so helpful* when people suggest alternative reviewers.

item.title: Albert Cardona
item.description: "A consensus cell type atlas from multiple connectomes reveals principles of circuit stereotypy and variation", by Schlegel et al. 2023 (Greg Jefferis lab at #MRCLMB in collaboration with the Bock, Murthy, and Seung labs, and also Volker Hartenstein)Interesting to me in particular, and here I see the hand of Volker Hartenstein (my postdoc adviser!), is the annotation of developmental units: the neuronal lineages (Fig 2 below).#Drosophila #connectomics #neuroscience #DevBiol

item.title: Jonathan Peelle
item.description: We have now reached the time of year when (at least in the Northern Hemisphere) it is nigh impossible to find reviewers in any timely fashion. This is good because it means some academics are taking a break 👍 but if you are an author it's good to know. Personally I usually just wait until September 1 to submit things at this point.

item.title: mike johansen
item.description: probably should have run this study 30 years ago. #opioids #backpain #medmastodon"Opioids should not be recommended for acute non-specific low back pain or neck pain given that we found no significant difference in pain severity compared with placebo. This finding calls for a change in the frequent use of opioids for these conditions."https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(23)00404-X/fulltext

item.title: ஐஇΛɔϛƐɐ‾ᄅ³ᄅᄅ™
item.description: 1983: “But for them (affirmative action laws), God only knows where I would be today. These laws and their proper application are all that stand between the first 17 years of my life and the second 17 years."2023: He votes to end using affirmative action in college admissions.

item.title: Tony Stark
item.description:
One thing I find especially sickening is the military exclusion. What SCOTUS Republicans are saying is it’s ok for Black and Brown kids to go to military academies and risk and lose their lives, but otherwise “make your own way.”As a reminder, SCOTUS obviously isn’t elected. But we do elect who appoints them. And confirms them. Affirmative action: The high cost of the Supreme Court’s decision, explained-
https://www.vox.com/scotus/23616868/supreme-court-affirmative-action-harvard-unc-students-fair-admissions-john-roberts
